Getting parameters data from tables files (Excel sheet, csv)

Source: R/read_params_table.R
read_params_table.Rd

Getting parameters data from tables files (Excel sheet, csv)

read_params_table(file_path, sheet_name = NULL, num_na = 999, char_na = "")

Arguments

file_path

Excel or csv file path
sheet_name

Name of an Excel sheet (useless for csv files)
num_na

Replacement value for numerical NA values
char_na

Replacement value for character NA values

Value

A tibble of parameters

Details

After data are loaded, numerical and string NA values are replaced repectively with num_na or str_na

Examples


usm_xl_file <-  download_usm_xl(xl_name = "inputs_stics_example.xlsx",
verbose = FALSE)
read_params_table(usm_xl_file, sheet = "USMs")
#> # A tibble: 12 x 17
#>    usm_name    datedebut datefin finit   nomsol fstation fclim1 fclim2 culturean
#>    <chr>           <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>  <chr>    <chr>  <chr>      <dbl>
#>  1 USM_2017_T…       199     263 USM_20… USM_T1 climate… clima… clima…         1
#>  2 USM_2018_T1       264     570 USM_20… USM_T1 climate… clima… clima…         2
#>  3 BIN_CAN_05…       199     263 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#>  4 BIN_AGT_04…       264     570 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#>  5 AGA_ARB_13…       199     263 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#>  6 AGA_ARB_13…       264     570 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#>  7 FRA_ARB_11…       199     263 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#>  8 MAG_ARB_09…       264     570 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#>  9 MAG_ARV_12…       199     263 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#> 10 MAG_ARV_12…       264     570 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#> 11 FRA_ARB_12…       199     263 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#> 12 FRA_ARB_13…       264     570 Vill11… LF1    climate… clima… clima…         2
#> # … with 8 more variables: nbplantes <dbl>, codesimul <dbl>, fplt_1 <chr>,
#> #   ftec_1 <chr>, flai_1 <chr>, fplt_2 <chr>, ftec_2 <chr>, flai_2 <chr>
usm_csv_file <- download_usm_csv(csv_name = "inputs_stics_example_USMs.csv",
verbose = FALSE)
read_params_table(file_path = usm_csv_file)
#> # A tibble: 12 x 17
#>    usm_name    datedebut datefin finit   nomsol fstation fclim1 fclim2 culturean
